fullStory:
Meet Zeppelin

At 12 years old, Zeppelin was experiencing the common challenges many senior dogs face. Weighing 35-40 lbs with mild to moderate activity levels, Shannon wanted to ensure her aging companion received the best possible nutrition support through this important life stage.

The Challenge

While Zeppelin was eating Farmers Dog twice daily—a quality commercial diet—Shannon wanted to explore personalized whole-food nutrition tailored specifically to Zeppelin's senior needs. The main areas of concern were:

  • Digestive Health: Needed support for optimal digestion as senior dogs often experience decreased digestive efficiency
  • Joint & Mobility: As a 12-year-old dog, Zeppelin required targeted nutrition to support joint health and maintain mobility
  • Skin & Coat: Maintaining healthy skin and a lustrous coat becomes more challenging in senior years

Christie's Clinical Recommendation

"I recommend transitioning from Farmers Dog to Waggin Meals, a whole-food-based diet tailored to support Zeppelin's digestive health, joint mobility, and skin & coat wellness." — Christie Naquin, Board-Certified Animal Nutritionist

For Digestive Health

  • Plain Yogurt: Probiotics for gut health and beneficial bacteria
  • Pumpkin: Natural fiber for digestive regularity
  • Sweet Potatoes, Blueberries & Carrots: Antioxidants to support overall health
  • Bone Broth: Amino acids for gut lining support and healing

For Joint & Mobility Support

  • Fatty Fish: Rich in omega-3 fatty acids to reduce inflammation
  • Eggs: High-quality protein and biotin for overall health
  • Bone Broth: Collagen and anti-inflammatory compounds essential for joint health

For Skin & Coat Health

  • Coconut Oil: Healthy fats for skin moisture and coat shine
  • Lean Proteins: Essential building blocks for healthy coat growth
  • Flaxseed & Salmon Oil: Omega fatty acids for skin and coat wellness

Personalized Feeding Plan

Daily Feeding

  • Amount: 2.0-2.5 cups total
  • Schedule: Split into two meals
  • Per Meal: 1-1¼ cups each

Weekly Needs

  • Total: 14.0-17.5 cups
  • Packs Required: 3.5-4.4 packs per week (4 cups per pack)
  • Recommendation: Order 1 extra pack per week for backup

Recommended Products

  • Waggin Meals formulas: Lamb, Salmon, or Beef
  • Bone Broth: 2-3 tablespoons per meal

Fresh Whole Food Feeding Guide

For dogs in Zeppelin's weight range (31-40 lbs):

  • Daily Cups (Moderate Activity): 1.75-2.25
  • Daily Cups (Active): 2.0-2.5 (+0.25)
  • Weekly Total: 14.0 cups
  • Packs per Week: 3.5

Christie's Professional Notes

Bone broth is essential for collagen and amino acids that benefit digestion, joint strength, and skin health in senior dogs like Zeppelin. The combination of fresh, whole-food ingredients with targeted supplementation provides comprehensive support for the unique needs of senior dogs.

Product Details

  • All products come in 4-cup BPA-free vacuum-sealed packs
  • Arrives frozen; thaw and refreeze as needed
  • Seasonal proteins available: Venison & Alaskan Salmon
  • Small batch crafted for quality and freshness
  • Sourced from our garden and trusted farms

The Waggin Meals Difference

At Waggin Meals, every bite matters, and every dog we serve is important. We craft meals in small batches for quality and freshness, sourcing from our garden and trusted farms committed to sustainability. Your dog's health and happiness are at the heart of everything we do.
